summary: Free content, like a book or a picture, is something everyone can use and share without copyright restrictions. It's often marked with a Creative Commons license, which the author uses to say how others can use their work. These licenses let people know if they can copy, change, or even sell the content. The author might ask for credit or have other simple rules. This way, creators can share their work while still having some control over how it's used.
title: Free content
